episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 18 - The ONE Way to Connect With Your Customers to Eliminate Risk and Boost Profit
episodes.summary:
How do you create something BIG... when you start with nothing?

You need to start by solving other people’s biggest problems. Our guest, Dane Maxwell, created a process that will help you identify your customer’s primary pain point, build a product with zero capital, and launch a business with zero risk.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [7:24] How to find the secret world where selling is effortless.
  • [11:40] How developing this power habit will change the way you think (and make business easier).
  • [27:11] How to avoid the most dangerous word in business.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

On your social media platform of choice, tell us about the ONE thing that you are taking action on because of this episode by using #theONEthing. We are listening and we want you to take ownership over the show – this is YOUR podcast!

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Check out Dane’s music: DaneMaxwell.com | Spotify
  • Learn more about Dane’s idea extraction process at TheFoundation.com
  • Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of Nike by Phil Knight

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 17 - Balancing work and family (a private call with one of YOU)
episodes.summary:
How do you prosper at home, crush it at work, and find the balance to thrive at both?

In this episode, we explore the challenges of thriving both as a parent and as a professional – and the small actions you can take to overcome those challenges.

This came up because Lori Roethler, today’s guest, joined one of our Facebook Live streams and mentioned she was struggling in this area of her life.

 

(If you want to join the conversation, our Facebook Live streams are every Monday and Thursday at 2:00 PM CST.)

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [2:15] Why balancing your personal and business life can make you feel guilty.
  • [6:12] Why you sometimes need to prioritize yourself first (even as a parent).
  • [8:45] Why big change often comes from taking small steps.
  • [10:48] How accountability can give you the support you need to crush goals.
  • [15:04] How you can leverage boundaries in your professional life to make your ONE thing at home easier or unnecessary.
  • [19:50] How you can prevent your phone from stealing personal time.
  • [26:42] The ONE thing to implement from this episode that will help you strike a balance between your professional and personal life.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

If you are looking to strike the balance between thriving personally and professionally, start by answering these two questions...

  1. What is the ONE thing you can do to be present with your family that will make them feel like you are there for them?
  1. How much focused quality time will that require? It’s not about the amount of time – it’s about the quality of time.

 

Now share your ONE thing with your family so that they can hold you accountable. Underpromise and overdeliver!

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Print out your own 66-Day Calendar
  • Join our Facebook Live streams every Monday and Thursday @ 2PM (CST)

 

AWESOME FREE RESOURCES FOR YOU!

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep. 16 - Holding people accountable (and making them love you for it)
episodes.summary:
We’ve been thinking about accountability wrong for years.

Accountability isn’t a punishment – it is a GIFT!

Today’s guest, Jonathan Raymond, is CEO of Refound and author of Good Authority. He will teach you how practicing accountability with kindness can lift people up, keep them on track, and help them be a better version of themselves.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [3:20] The BIG thing missing in most business conversations.
  • [5:42] What accountability REALLY means.
  • [6:53] Why accountability is not fundamentally about consequences.
  • [8:40] How you can communicate your expectations with clarity.
  • [10:50] Why it is your responsibility as a manager to take ownership of the accountability process.
  • [12:03] How to have positive conversations about accountability using the five-part Accountability Dial.
  • [14:10] Why self-awareness and transparency are critical if you want to be a better manager.
  • [17:23] How to reframe conversations with employees so that you can build them up.
  • [20:55] How you can reframe conversations about accountability in your personal relationships so that you can grow together.
  • [23:13] How to have the perfect conservation.
  • [27:35] ONE mindset shift that you have to make if you want to be a great manager.
  • [30:15] How this dirty little management secret can improve long-term productivity and happiness.
  • [34:00] Why establishing clear boundaries will set your team up for success.
  • [39:53] What to do when you’re out of management options.
  • [41:26] Why handling difficult management situations correctly will help your team see that you’re an awesome manager and transform the company culture.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

You can practice your management skills, help a struggling employee, and affect positive change in their life using The Growth Meeting Guide.

  1. Set aside 30 minutes.
  2. Identify a team member who is concerning or frustrating you.
  3. Fill out Refound’s Growth Meeting Guide. Answer each question honestly.
  4. You will receive personalized step-by-step instructions for having effective 1x1 meetings with your team, including scripts and question prompts.
  5. Follow the guide to set up meetings over the next 7, 30 or 365 days.

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Learn More from Jonathan at Refound.com:
    • The Accountability Dial - Infographic
    • The Growth Meeting Guide - A free tool that will help you turn your concerns and frustrations into action
    • The Good Authority Bootcamp - A 6-week management training program that combines an online course with group and individual mentoring
  • Good Authority: How to Become the Leader Your Team Is Waiting For by Jonathan Raymond
  • Watch Simon Sinek Answer “The Millennial Question”

 

AWESOME FREE RESOURCES FOR YOU!

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep. 15 - Tiny Tweaks That Give You BIG Boosts
episodes.summary:
Where there’s a will, there’s a way. True or false?

FALSE!

Willpower (like gas in a tank) is a finite resource. You can do powerful things with willpower, but sometimes willpower fails or you simply run out of it.

Jay Papasan, co-author of The ONE Thing, is back to share what our team discovered about the willpower myth so that you can be more productive.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [1:00] What willpower is… and what it isn’t.
  • [2:10] Why your willpower is never unlimited.
  • [3:30] How to refuel your cognitive stamina.
  • [4:38] ONE little trick to keep you focused (without a coffee break).
  • [5:33] AH-HA Moment: When you should focus on your most important work.
  • [7:26] Why you should make important decisions when you have more willpower.
  • [8:21] Why being extraordinary is a cumulative process.
  • [11:45] How you can create a positive halo effect in your life by doing this for just 15 minutes a day.
  • [14:20] How this big misconception about The ONE Thing holds you back.
  • [14:42] The ONE thing to implement from this episode.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

The ONE Thing isn’t about picking the right ONE thing – it’s about picking something. Pick something that you can do for yourself or your business, first thing in the morning, that will give you positive momentum. It can be as simple as making your bed or working for your first 15 minutes in the office… just give yourself a WIN!

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • “Do You Believe These Six Productivity Myths?”

 

AWESOME FREE RESOURCES FOR YOU!

  • Make the most out of your willpower with our cheat sheet!
  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep. 14 - Scaling your business will never happen unless...
episodes.summary:
Are you working hard and still struggling to scale your business?

You might be making business too complicated. Cameron Herold has scaled multiple companies to over $100M by keeping things simple. He’s on the show to teach you...

  • simple techniques that will set you up for long-term success.
  • why business is not as complicated as we make it.
  • how to avoid burnout.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [1:50] Why focusing on this ONE metric will solve almost any business problem.
  • [3:48] How to hone your focus.
  • [4:46] How time blocking will help you do the things that matter most to you AND scale a business.
  • [7:14] How to leverage The Five F’s to avoid business burnout and bring your best self home.
  • [9:13] Why working nights and weekends isn’t worth it.
  • [11:42] How to create a work sanctuary and de-stress (even if you work from home).
  • [14:00] ONE exercise to reconnect with your childhood hobbies and passions.
  • [16:25] How you can choose to be a human BEING versus a human DOING.
  • [21:15] How to make yourself a successful and passionate role model for your kids.
  • [24:23] How you can use leverage to create momentum.
  • [31:12] Simple computer shortcuts that can save you a ton of time.
  • [33:28] The ONE thing to implement from this episode.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

You will blow the doors off of your business if, on a daily basis, you just focus on the things you can do that will create the most impact. We challenge you to start tomorrow.

  • Make a list of five things that you need to get done tomorrow.
  • Put them in order from highest impact to lowest impact.
  • Place the list somewhere you will see it all day.
  • First thing tomorrow, start working on item one. Don’t do anything else until it’s done.
  • Repeat with each item until you are done with your work day. Even if you don’t finish everything, you will still complete your most important work.

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • TextExpander - Keyboard shortcut app for Mac & Windows
  • CommitTo3 - Accountability app
  • Affordable Ways to Delegate: Fiverr | UpWork | Hire My Mom
  • Cameron’s Books:
    • Double Double by Cameron Herold: Amazon | Audible
    • The Miracle Morning For Entrepreneurs by Hal Elrod & Cameron Herold: Amazon | Audible
    • Meetings Suck by Cameron Herold: Amazon

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 13 - The Top Questions Fans Like YOU Have on Productivity
episodes.summary:
Do you ever feel like you’re the only person struggling to get everything done?

Don’t worry – everyone struggles with productivity sometimes. In this episode we’re going to answer 20 powerful questions that fans of The ONE Thing asked about productivity during our monthly webinar.

We host a monthly webinar series because we want to add more value to your life. If you want to sign up for our next FREE monthly webinar, head over to the1thing.com/webinars.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [3:45] How to maintain momentum while working on your ONE thing.
  • [5:36] How to avoid distractions.
  • [8:07] Two strategies for practicing mindfulness when your mind is a distraction.
  • [9:15] How to accomplish BIG goals through small and consistent action.
  • [11:25] How to delegate like a millionaire.
  • [14:00] How to get out of your inbox – and stay out.
  • [16:03] Why you need to enlist support to focus on your ONE thing.
  • [20:55] Why you should share your goals (and failures) with the most important people in your life.
  • [24:39] Why trying to focus on many things will make everything harder.
  • [29:02] How to optimize your energy throughout the day.
  • [30:07] What you can do when the job being asked of you is not aligned with your ONE thing.
  • [32:10] How to say no without ticking people off.
  • [35:14] How to help motivation find you.
  • [37:38] How to stop yourself from looking at social media while you are focused on your ONE thing.
  • [39:03] How to affect change in unproductive people.
  • [41:30] How to leverage your 4-1-1 to overcome procrastination.
  • [43:55] One 60-second exercise that will help hone your focus.
  • [47:42] Why surrounding yourself with the right people will help clarify your ONE thing.

 

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

Focus is like a muscle. To strengthen your focus, you need to exercise that muscle every day. Start right now taking action on one thing for just 60 seconds. Can you prove to yourself that you can be present for the next 60 seconds? If so, GREAT! Now it’s about making it a habit and expanding your focus time, over time.

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Sign up for our next FREE monthly webinar
  • Like our Facebook Page to catch our Facebook Live sessions twice a week
  • Add us on Snapchat @the1thingbook for daily updates

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 12 - The 6 LIES Crushing Your Productivity
episodes.summary:
Do you ever feel like you’re doing a lot of work without getting anything done?

We live in a culture obsessed with productivity… but we struggle to control our own time because we’ve been lied to about productivity for our whole lives.

Laura Hanly and Garrett Linderman, two valuable members of The ONE Thing team, will help you gain control over your time by revealing the 6 lies that are crushing your productivity.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [1:40] Lie #1: Everything matters equally.
  • [3:05] How to define the things that truly matter.
  • [5:10] Lie #2: Multitasking.
  • [7:45] Five steps to get super focused and control your environment.
  • [8:50] How to eliminate multitasking.
  • [9:53] Lie #3: A disciplined life.
  • [10:06] How to leverage your limited discipline and create a powerful habit.
  • [11:27] Lie #4: Willpower is always on will call.
  • [12:09] The difference between willpower and discipline.
  • [13:10] Why you should save your most important work for the morning.
  • [15:16] Lie #5: A balanced life.
  • [16:24] Why we assign undue importance to maintaining a work-life balance.
  • [18:48] Lie #6: Big is bad.
  • [19:02] How to think like Gary Keller – BIG and BOLD.

 

The ONE Thing to Take Away From This Episode:

Turn your to-do list into a success list! Consider the 80/20 Principle, which states that 20 percent of efforts or actions tend to produce 80 percent of results. A success list will help you make the most out of that 20 percent.

  • Write down all of the things that you need to do.
  • Rank every task in order of priority.
  • Focus on finishing your #1 priority first. You don’t earn the right to work on your second priority until you finish your first priority.
    • Limit the distractions in your environment. Put on headphones, block out irregular sounds, place food and drink within reach, and close anything with notifications (or just turn off your internet!).

 

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Learn more about The Six Lies That Crush Your Productivity
    • Lie #1: Everything Matters Equally
    • Lie #2: Multitasking
    • Lie #3: A Disciplined Life
    • Lie #4: Willpower is Always on Will Call
    • Lie #5: A Balanced Life
    • Lie #6: Big is Bad

 

AWESOME FREE RESOURCES FOR YOU!

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 11 - Building Coffee Bean's into an Empire - Fmr CEO Annie Hyman Pratt
episodes.summary:
Do you ever wonder what it will take to scale your business into an empire?

Today you get to meet the former CEO of The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf, Amy Hyman Pratt, who will break down how she scaled her business by focusing on three things:

  1. Accountability
  2. Top talent
  3. Showing up as the best version of herself

In this episode you will learn...

  • [4:19] A difficult (and expensive) decision Annie had to make because it was the right decision.
  • [7:15] Why scaling a business can lead to huge challenges.
  • [9:47] Why micromanaging can hurt your organization.
  • [11:30] AH-HA Moment: The moment Annie realized she needed to make a huge mindset shift.
  • [13:20] Why you need to create a culture of open and honest communication in your organization.
  • [14:42] Why you need to take responsibility for leveling up your mindset when you are affected by limiting beliefs.
  • [15:43] How you can create a psychologically safe environment for your team.
  • [16:55] How you can learn to succeed through others.
  • [17:50] Why honoring your core values will force you to sacrifice something – and guide you towards long-term success.
  • [21:24] How to identify YOUR North Star...
  • [22:25] ...and the ONE thing you can do to stick to it.
  • [25:54] Why these three things will help you build a team that grows quickly – without losing your ONE thing.

The ONE Thing to Take Away From This Episode:

Ask this question to assess the accountability of prospective talent: “Tell me about a time when a mistake was made in an organization and you got blamed hardcore for it. What was the situation, how did it turn out, and what would you do differently next time?”

  • IMPAQentrepreneur.com
  • RapidBusinessGrowthIntensive.com

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 10 - [CASE STUDY] How Peggy Delano turned her health around and EXPLODED her business
episodes.summary:
Can you imagine waking up and realizing that, for decades, you were developing catastrophically unhealthy habits?

Unfortunately, this was a reality for a listener of this podcast.

Peggy Delano has been a fan of The ONE Thing for years. Recently though, she knew she needed to make a change – but wasn’t sure how to.

This episode is a case study of what can happen when you decide to…

  • Make a change
  • Surround yourself with the right group of people
  • Execute simple daily actions that contribute to a greater goal.

It’s never too late to make a positive change.

In this episode you will learn...

  • [4:00] The most important thing to focus on when you are making a change.
  • [6:50] Why your lead domino might have nothing to do with your business.
  • [9:09] AH-HA Moment: It’s okay to struggle with time blocking. It’s okay to struggle with what your ONE thing is.
  • [11:05] Why enlisting support is critical to making a big change in your life.
  • [12:10] Why the fear of failing to change comes from a lack of true commitment.
  • [13:10] The incredible result of committing to a 66-Day Challenge, with support.
  • [14:55] How knocking down your lead domino can help you show up as your authentic self in every part of your life.
  • [22:05] The ONE thing to implement from this episode.

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

Think of the big goal you have for yourself. What is the big goal that you know you need to make meaningful progress on and, for whatever reason, have failed to do so? Give yourself permission to think BIG!

Establish one specific, measurable action that you can do today. Prove to yourself that you can take action today – not tomorrow. If you start executing a small step every day, you will be amazed by the results.

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • Learn more about Time Blocking at GetTimeBlockingMastery.com

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar
  • Check out our awesome blog!
  • [FREE Training] How to Start Time Blocking TODAY!

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 9 - The BIG mistake we made (that you may be making right now)
episodes.summary:
What do you want people to remember you for? What is your legacy?

If you want to create a lasting legacy, every action you take needs to reflect your values.

We were playing the short-term game to grow revenue, but we needed to focus on our core values – our ONE thing.

There’s a price attached to our values, but there’s also a reward when we stick to them.

Jay Papasan, co-author of The ONE Thing, is back to explain how he knew we were making a mistake and to teach you how we corrected course.

In this episode you will learn...

  • [0:50] Why your values aren’t really your values unless they cost you something.
  • [1:38] The BIG Mistake we made (that you may be making right now).
  • [2:20] Why the best businesses have a mission and a clear purpose.
  • [8:30] AH-HA Moment: We need to come from a place of value. Your trust is worth infinitely more than your money.
  • [9:34] Why negative interactions can help you identify problems and solve them.
  • [13:04] Clarity matters. Getting clear about your values is a foundational idea that people don’t give enough focus.
  • [14:05] Why there’s no reason to repeat other people’s mistakes.

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

Identify what you want your legacy to be. What do you want people to say you stood for? Then reflect on how you are showing up in the world on a daily basis… Do you need to make any adjustments?

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 8 - Struggling to find balance in your personal and professional life? Here is one thing that will help…
episodes.summary:
Can your personal relationships be improved? Do you find it difficult to switch from work mode to home mode?

When you are hyper focused on work, your life can fall off balance.

That’s why we brought Alison onto the show to help you clarify your direction and focus your vision.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [4:00] It’s possible to appreciate your personal life and still not find every activity stimulating.
  • [6:30] Why physical activity can help shift your focus away from work.
  • [8:45] How you can develop creative solutions to make your home experience more engaging for everyone.
  • [10:30] Why more accountability in your personal life can be a powerful motivator.
  • [11:40] How time blocking can be implemented in your personal life
  • [15:30] How you can make a little tweak to your personal routine to make it better for you and the people in your life.
  • [17:30] The importance of showing up in an effective manner, even when you’re tired.
  • [19:00] How just a few minutes of Family Yoga can help center a whole family.
  • [22:50] The critical role that reliability plays in your personal life.
  • [26:00] The biggest challenge in establishing a healthy work-life balance.
  • [28:00] One 2-minute exercise you can do now to center yourself and shift your perspective.

The ONE Thing to Implement From This Episode:

A short exercise to help find balance in your personal and professional life:

  • Close your eyes for a moment.
  • Take one or two deep breaths to center your body.
  • Imagine that you are a fly on the wall in your home and you can see your family or friends.
  • Look from the perspective of a fly on the wall and write down what you see, in terms of what is beautiful about them.
  • What’s amazing about these people who are in your life?

Links & Tools From This Episode

  • The ONE Thing: Website | Book
  • Alison’s Website – Alison Cardy specializes in helping men and women around the world with career changes

  • Form your first power habit with your 66 Day Challenge Calendar

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 7 - How to identify top talent in 90 days or less
episodes.summary:
Do you feel stuck? Is your business struggling with growth?

If you ever feel like you’re hitting a ceiling, you are probably missing a person.

Jay Papasan, co-author of The One Thing, is on the show to help you find the coach, mentor or employee you need to break through the ceiling.

 

In this episode you will learn...

  • [1:30] When Jay Papasan and Gary Keller identified a bigger opportunity for The ONE Thing brand.
  • [2:25] The inspiration that led to Jay’s AH-HA moment.
  • [4:55] How Jay knew The ONE Thing team was missing someone: a leader.
  • [8:00] Gary Keller’s technique for evaluating new talent.
  • [10:00] How listening to your audience can focus your vision.
  • [10:30] The two productivity skills that most people struggle with.
  • [12:55] The power of networking for attracting top talent.
  • [14:00] How our team is applying lessons learned from The ONE Thing.
  • [16:00] Jay’s killer advice for hiring an executive assistant.
  • [18:00] One easy strategy for being more intentional in your relationships that you can use today.

 

The ONE Thing to Take Action on Today:

Be more purposeful in an important relationship that is hurting. It can be any type of relationship.

  • Step One: Identify a relationship in your life that is struggling.
  • Step Two: Consider the core things that you are looking for in that relationship.
  • Step Three: Test a solution to the pain you are experiencing in the relationship. Communicate clearly and often to create a better opportunity for success.

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 6 - What 794 people like you taught us about time blocking
episodes.summary:
Have you been distracted today?

If we are intentional with our time, we can defeat distraction.

Today’s guest, Valerie Tourangeau, is just like you. She was a fan of The ONE Thing for years, and then she finally implemented its powerful lessons.

Now, she is able to dismiss the distractions and focus on her ONE thing, every day, because she is a time blocking master.

Time Blocking is the act of scheduling time for yourself to do your most important tasks. It sounds simple, but most people struggle with committing time to themselves every day.

Discussed in this episode:

  • 1:45 - Valerie isn’t alone. A lot of people have said they read The ONE Thing and they love the book, but they never implemented the book. Why?
  • 2:00 - 66 days can seem daunting, and finding a ONE thing in a world full of so many distractions seems like it won’t make the difference – but it really does.
  • 2:30 - We say 66 days because, after five years of research, we discovered that it takes 66 full days to form a habit.
  • 6:05 - Implementing The ONE Thing can expose a lot of your weaknesses. When Valerie went through the Time Blocking Mastery Course, what was one of the first weaknesses that popped up for her that really surprised her?
  • 7:30 - The Halo Effect: When you do ONE thing, the right thing, it can end up knocking over many other things.
  • 9:30 - Focusing on your ONE thing is more about momentum and less about being perfect. Tell us more about that.
  • 11:30 - What are some of the biggest mistakes that people make when they first try to time block?
  • 15:15 - What has shifted in Valerie’s life because of time blocking?
  • 22:20 - We should be able to walk away from this episode and be able to take action and implement one simple thing that will actually give us a win in our lives. What would Valerie suggest we do?

If you want to make a greater commitment to yourself, download our free 66-Day Calendar and start your own 66-Day Challenge today.

Mastering the art of time blocking can completely transformed your life. If you want to form a powerful habit that sticks, check out the Time Blocking Mastery course.

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 4. Would this turn your world upside down?
episodes.summary:
If you are reading this, then I know a lot about you.

You are a high achiever. You have massive goals and aspirations. You are unwavering in your commitment to accomplishing your goals.

I'm the same way.

When we have massive dreams, we tend to look for the fastest way to get there and run. The thing we usually don't do is ask the most important question: am I truly building something that can scale with or without me?

If you want to build a brand that can scale, grow, live, breathe and thrive with or without you, then you need clarity about the ONE thing that will make everything else easier or unnecessary.

Focus on accomplishing that ONE thing and say no to everything else because you haven't earned the right to focus on anything else yet – this is the surprisingly simple truth behind extraordinary results.

Now you have the knowledge. Time to back it up with action.

Take a look at all of the things you do throughout the day. How much of your daily schedule directly supports you accomplishing your ONE thing? If you don't think you're investing enough time in your top priority, then how can you make a change?

 

Go to Facebook.com/theonethingbook and share with us. What's your ONE thing and where do you need help?

I want to engage with you and I want to add value to your life. I've seen what happens when you live The ONE Thing, and I know what it can do for you.

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep 3 – How habit and discipline helped Chris Heller become CEO of Keller Williams
episodes.summary:
Time is your most valuable asset. Are you wasting it?

Chris Heller, CEO of Keller-Williams, rose to the top through discipline – a muscle that you need to develop to make the most out of your time.

You develop discipline by creating better habits.

Chris created habits that improved his mindset and maintained his health.

Mindset is critical for overcoming fear and taking action. One of the most important mindset shifts that Chris made as part of KW was learning to succeed through others.

When you have the right people, the fear of losing control transforms into relief.  

Even with support, you can’t achieve everything you want to accomplish in your life and your business if you’re health isn’t close to 100%. You can’t let your health fall through the cracks when you are focusing on your business.

If you want to achieve more, while working less, then you need the right habits to develop your discipline muscle. Chris Heller is here to show you how.

 

Discussed in this episode:

  • 2:45 - How does Chris teach people to control their calendar?
  • 6:45 - Everybody inside the real estate world knows that lead generation is the ONE thing that makes everything else easier or unnecessary, but why is it so hard for them to do it?
  • 10:25 - When you focus on your business, it’s easy for your health to fall through the cracks. How did Chris make health a habit?
  • 14:40 - The idea of succeeding through others: is it something that came naturally to Chris or is it something he had to work at?
  • 15:55 - People hear they should succeed through others, they know they should succeed through others, yet for some reason there’s something that holds them back. If you could give them ONE thing to help them pave that way, what does that look like?
  • 17:10 - How did Chris become the type of person that talent wants to work for, and are willing to take a discount to do it?

episodes.summary:
If you are struggling with organization, it’s not your fault.

You probably haven't been taught what it takes to get organized at work.

I know nobody ever sat me down and showed me how to get organized, until I started working with Gary Keller and Jay Papasan.

Today I want to share with you what I've learned about getting organized and the research that our team has uncovered about what it takes to be productive at work.

There are four key areas that you need to organize:

  1. Mind
  2. Time
  3. Physical Workspace
  4. Projects

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep. 1 - Discover the future of productivity
episodes.summary:
This show is for you if you have big dreams and big goals for your life… but you find yourself getting distracted.

I struggled to live a productive life for years, but I was introduced to the future or productivity: The ONE Thing by Gary Keller and Jay Papasan.

The future is about simplification and elimination. It’s about looking at all of the things you could do and narrowing those down to the things that you should do. It’s about focusing on the ONE thing you can do that will make everything else easier or unnecessary.

If you are committed to living a big life and making a big impact along the way, then you need The ONE Thing – and we want to give it to you for FREE.

episodes.seriesTitle: The ONE Thing | Powered by Produktive
episodes.title: Ep. 0 - The ONE Thing: The Surprisingly Simple Truth Behind Extraordinary Results
episodes.summary:
The chips have been stacked against you.

 

Ever since you were a kid, you were taught to get a good job and work hard so that you could retire.

But you weren’t taught the things that you deserved to learn most: how to focus, how to look at the all the things you could do, and how to narrow it down to the ONE thing that you should do.

They didn’t teach you to find your purpose – but that all changes today.

 

Together, you and your host Geoff Woods will go on an incredible journey to unlock the secrets that should have been given to you when you were a kid. This information comes from the best-selling book The ONE Thing, which was co-authored by Gary Keller and Jay Papasan.

Get ready to learn the surprisingly simple truth behind extraordinary results.
